tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about dehydration?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, absolutely. In most cases, a Maple doctor can diagnose dehydration online by asking about your symptoms and observing your condition. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they will be able to diagnose, prescribe appropriate medication, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment.
tab_content.accordion_content: If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest you go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or we’ll deliver it right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Dehydration occurs when your body doesn’t have enough water. It can be mild, moderate, or severe depending on how much water your body is lacking.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of dehydration?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Symptoms include:

  • Dry skin
  • Fatigue
  • Feeling dizzy
  • Headache
  • Increased breathing
tab_content.accordion_content:
• Increased heartbeat
  • Thirst
  • Urinating less often
  • Urine that is dark yellow

tab_content.accordion_intro: Replenishing the water lost from your body is the most effective form of treatment for dehydration.
tab_content.accordion_content: If you’re mildly or moderately dehydrated, a fluid high in electrolytes, such as a sports drink, is recommended to help bring the dissolved minerals in your body back into balance.  For severe dehydration, urgent in-person treatment is required.

tab_content.accordion_intro:
